snippet: The e-commerce giant has agreed to pay nearly $700 million for a minority stake in Intime to form an “online-to-offline” joint retail business.
abstract: Alibaba Group, China's biggest e-commerce firm, agrees to pay nearly $700 million for a minority stake in Chinese department store operator Intime Retail Group; move is part of plan to form an 'online-to-offline' joint retail business.
lead_paragraph: The e-commerce giant has agreed to pay nearly $700 million for a minority stake in Intime to form an “online-to-offline” joint retail business.

headline.main: Alibaba Ventures Offline With Stake in Chinese Retail Group
headline.print_headline: Alibaba Bets on Offline, With Stake in a Retailer
